subject: Marketing
title: Nudge Theory
description: Learn Nudge Theory in one minute.

hook.text: A cafeteria puts fruit at eye level and hides candy below. Fruit sales rise 25%.

buildup.text: Thaler and Sunstein call this choice architecture. Small design changes shape big decisions.

discovery.text: Nudges preserve freedom of choice while steering people toward better outcomes.

twist.text: But who decides what's 'better'? Nudges can be paternalistic or self-serving.

climax.text: Ethical nudges are transparent, reversible, and aligned with the person's own goals.

punchline.text: Guide the choice. Never remove it.

quiz.question: What makes a nudge ethical according to nudge theory?
options: It is transparent, reversible, and aligned with the person's goals
It forces the best outcome regardless of preference
It only applies to food and health choices
